Michtam of David. Preserve me, O God: for in thee do I put my trust.<RF>Michtam: or, A golden Psalm<Rf>
<FI>O my soul<Fi>, thou hast said unto the LORD, Thou <FI>art<Fi> my Lord: my goodness <FI>extendeth<Fi> not to thee;
<FI>But<Fi> to the saints that <FI>are<Fi> in the earth, and <FI>to<Fi> the excellent, in whom <FI>is<Fi> all my delight.

Their sorrows shall be multiplied <FI>that<Fi> hasten <FI>after<Fi> another <FI>god<Fi>: their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take up their names into my lips.<RF>hasten…: or, give gifts to another<Rf>
The LORD <FI>is<Fi> the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.<RF>of mine…: Heb. of my part<Rf>
The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant <FI>places<Fi>; yea, I have a goodly heritage.
I will bless the LORD, who hath given me counsel: my reins also instruct me in the night seasons.<CM>
I have set the LORD always before me: because <FI>he is<Fi> at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.<RF>rest…: Heb. dwell confidently<Rf>
For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence <FI>is<Fi> fulness of joy; at thy right hand <FI>there are<Fi> pleasures for evermore.<CM>
